faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-Spanish citizens can purchase property in Spain. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and may need to open a Spanish bank account. Many international buyers use Spanish property lawyers to navigate the purchasing process. We can provide referrals to English-speaking legal professionals.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs including transfer tax (6-11% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (1-2%). In Almería, total closing costs typically range from 8-13% of the property price. Our team can provide detailed breakdowns for MONTE CARMELO.
